page.title: 04Arable farming
page.content: The area to the east of Church Fenton is an arable farming area. The farms are family owned and range in size from 32 acres to 700 acres. Cereal crops include winter wheat and barley, spring barley and wheat, oil seed rape and a few winter oats. The cereals are mainly used for animal feed with some milling wheat and the rape for cooking oil. Most straw is baled and the excess burnt. Important root crops are main crop potatoes and sugar beet. The sugar beet is sent to the British Sugar Corporation factory in York. Peas are grown for protien in animal feed and other crops include mangolds,turnips and kale. Most farms own their own combine harvester, contracters are often used for sugar beet lifting and extra casual labour employed for potato picking.
